info.game_comments:
1999-B Teen Tournament semifinal game 1.
  From the Theater at Madison Square Garden, New York City.

(1, 1).clue: Based in Seattle, this site that began in 1995 has "Earth's Biggest Selection of Products", including books

(3, 1).clue: "Hit So Hard" by this Courtney Love group was heard on the season 2 finale of "Dawson's Creek"

(5, 1).clue: Number of square feet in a square yard

(6, 1).clue: This stout dwarf bulked up on the Campbell's line of the same name

(1, 2).clue: "Do You" use this top web directory, also one of the oldest?

(2, 2).clue: In 1893 this architect opened his own practice in Chicago; later he moved it to Oak Park

(3, 2).clue: Side projects by members of this band have included Hovercraft, featuring Eddie Vedder

(5, 2).clue: The first reliable mercury-in-glass thermometers used this temperature scale

(6, 2).clue: His reddish hair makes his head look like it's covered with ferric oxide

(1, 3).clue: The official site of this TV show includes the Bestiary, bios of evil characters like vampires Spike & Drusilla

(2, 3).clue: Scientist seen here as a child with one of his special "relatives"

(3, 3).clue: The name of this "Kiss Me" band means that man cannot give God any wealth that isn't God's already

(5, 3).clue: Generally, a double one of these should have over 300 coils, a kingsize one over 450

(6, 3).clue: Though that canine skin disease caused by mites has cleared up, he still has this nickname

(1, 4).clue: Find out about the musical group Sugar Ray & buy 550s & 517s online from this jeans maker

(2, 4).clue: She has written "The Chimpanzee Family Book" & "My Friends the Wild Chimpanzees"

(3, 4).clue: This punky band brought some color to the charts in 1995 with "When I Come Around"

(5, 4).clue: The National Fire Protection Association Code says the 4 letters on this sign must be at least 6" tall

(6, 4).clue: Inferences made by this peachy-skinned dwarf are known as the same type of "logic"

(1, 5).clue: This site features a column called "Sites & Sounds", the Heatseekers Showcase & the Hot 100 chart

(2, 5).clue: In 1960 Fidel Castro won a fishing tournament in Cuba that was named for this American author

(3, 5).clue: Let's clear things up: that "Whoo-Hoo" song by this band became an anthem of the National Hockey League

(5, 5).clue: In Old England, a sack was a unit of weight for this fiber covering 364 pounds; so 3 sacks full weighed 1092 lbs.

(6, 5).clue: This name can mean "sticky to the touch", or refer to his flashy, unfashionable clothes

(1, 1).clue: In the 1996 movie "Kazaam", he played a genie with a 12-year-old master

(2, 1).clue: Take a deep breath & name this product of human respiration seen here

(3, 1).clue: He wrote, "Hear the loud alarum bells -- brazen bells!  What a tale of terror, now their turbulency tells!"

(5, 1).clue: While Pelham Bay Park in the Bronx is NYC's largest park, this 840-acre one in Manhattan is more famous

(6, 1).clue: Yo-ho-ho, it's the number of men "on the dead man's chest" in a "Treasure Island" pirate song

(1, 2).clue: This 19-year-old Swiss tennis star is the daughter of a top Czech tennis player & a tennis coach

(2, 2).clue: Chemical name of the salt produced when sodium hydroxide, NaOH, meets hydrochloric acid, HCl

(3, 2).clue: His "Ode on a Grecian Urn" gave us the line "Beauty is truth, truth beauty"

(5, 2).clue: This jewelry store has added sparkle & pizzazz to NYC since 1853; breakfast, anyone?

(6, 2).clue: On July 1, 1971 this became the USA's minimum voting age

(1, 3).clue: In a Nike ad, this Mariner saves the Earth by batting away a meteor

(2, 3).clue: This term commonly describes the shape of the benzine molecule seen here

(3, 3).clue: Robert Frost's poem that begins, "Something there is that doesn't love a wall"

(5, 3).clue: The names of over 500,000 immigrants appear on a wall of honor at the Immigration Museum on this island

(6, 3).clue: Number of the 1865 amendment to the Constitution that outlawed slavery in the U.S.

(1, 4).clue: The '96 Olympic Gymnastics team reunited (as bridesmaids) when this balance beam champ got hitched in '99

(2, 4).clue: A nitrogen molecule, N2, is held together by a triple chemical bond of this type

(3, 4).clue: "Just as you feel when you look on the river and sky, so I felt", he wrote in "Crossing Brooklyn Ferry"

(4, 4).clue: King George III,Queen Mary I,Queen Elizabeth II

(5, 4).clue: Across the way from Columbia University, you'll find this famous college for women

(6, 4).clue: Number of Woodrow Wilson's "Points" outlining Allied aims in WWI

(1, 5).clue: Rena Mero, a former WWF women's champion, wrestled under this name

(2, 5).clue: In the boric acid molecule seen here, the yellow ball represents this element

(3, 5).clue: An ode by Shelley calls this "Thou breath of autumn's being"

(5, 5).clue: While SoHo is south of Houston Street, this fashionable district occupies a "triangle below Canal" Street

(6, 5).clue: Number of guests who attended the Valhalla banquet at which Balder was slain

(0, 0).clue: In 1999 only a few hundred Americans known as Zonians were left in this country
